#JUNETEENTH2020 marks 155 years since the emancipation of Black Americans in Galveston, TX. It also coincides with powerful demonstrations across our country and in our city, protesting the injustices Black Americans still face every day. Now more than ever, we must remain vigilant on the road to equality, commit ourselves to challenging the status quo, uplift marginalized voices and let the community lead, as they have continued to do so during these difficult times.

In honor of the moment, I have signed an Executive Order to remove the term "Plantations" from all City documents and ceremonies. While there is still much more to be done, we must remain vigilant on the road to equality and raise our voices in concert at the sight of injustice.
